Class UserInterface

java.lang.Object
UserInterface
public class UserInterface
extends java.lang.Object
UserInterface Class Class that serves as a front-end interface for a user Creates all the Grammar objects, from their grammarTitle creates a menu Takes in input from the user to allow them to select a grammar and then generates and prints it

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    UserInterface()
    Constructor Sets String directory = null initially, because we will read the directory from the console and assign it later (in the setDirectory method) Also creates an empty ArrayList of Grammars We will create and place the available Grammars there based on the files in the directory

      public java.lang.String menuCommand() throws java.io.IOException
      Method that uses the ArrayList of Grammars to create the option menu, with all the Grammars listed in a numbered list
      Returns:
      String of user input from the command line, menu option chosen drives program sequence
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - default IO error

      BufferedReader object from user terminal input

    • getTestInput

      Helper method that passes a default argument for test purposes, quits application Returns a buffered reader object for readINput method to read lines
      Returns:
      BufferedReader object simulating terminal input

    • handleInput

      public void handleInput​(java.lang.String input) throws java.io.IOException, NoSuchGrammarTypeException
      Method that handles the selected Grammar choice (or 'q' to quit) and constructs the sentence Once it is done, it prints the sentence to the console, and then prompts the user for a new input, and reads it
      Parameters:
      input - String (the user's selected menu choice, which has been checked and is valid)
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - default IO error
      NoSuchGrammarTypeException - custom error class for no grammar type exists in grammar JSON

      Overridden hashCode method for default hashCode()

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args) throws NoSuchDirectoryException, java.io.IOException, org.json.simple.parser.ParseException, NoSuchGrammarTypeException
      Main method for the user interface program Is called with a command line argument, which is the directory where the grammar .json files are located. With this, it creates a UserInterface object (or throws an error if the directory is not valid). The program is also terminated if the user doesn't pass a command line argument (directory). Reads all the .json grammar files, creates Grammar objects, and adds them to the Grammars list. Then, prompts the user with menu options and prints appropriate Grammar sentences.
      Parameters:
      args - String directory where all the grammar .json files are located
      Throws:
      NoSuchDirectoryException - custom error class for when provided directly doesn't exist
      java.io.IOException - default IO error
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - default parse error for handling JSON text file
      NoSuchGrammarTypeException - custom error class for no grammar type exists in grammar JSON
